document_data.caption: ''The mass chaos of Limbo.''
document_data.name: Limbo
document_data.gravity-GW: Subjective Directional: normal when touching a solid object, otherwise No Gravity
document_data.text:
You want a map of Limbo.
Uh huh.
I suppose you want to know the [[Lady of Pain]]'s address too.
I'd give it to you, but I promised her I wouldn't.
document_data.mainbody:
The realms of the powers that resided in Limbo floated through the various layers at will and so are listed here in no particular order.
* The slaad lords [[Ssendam]] and [[Ygorl]] maintained realms most often found in the first layer but away from areas not under their control. Ssendam's citadel is a golden castle, while Ygorl's realm is a chain of carved spheres that whirl about.
* The githzerai formed [[hamlet]]s, [[village]]s, and two large cities out of the chaos. The first one was know as [[Shra'kt'lor]], which was the center of their military might, while the second known as the [[Floating City]] or [[Citadel of Gith]] and was a religious center of their race. Both of them were ruled over by [[Zaerith Menyar-Ag-Gith]] (the Great Githzerai).
* ''[[Fennimar]]'' was the realm of [[Fenmarel Mestarine]] before moving to [[Arvandor]]. [[Shevarash]], the Black Archer, also often stayed there.
* [[Targus]], the [[Netherese]] god of war, lived here,<ref> before moving to [[Pandemonium]] under his new name of Garagos.<ref>
* [[Tempus]] Foehammer, Lord of Battles once lived in Limbo. ''Knight's Rest'' was the name of his realm which later became its own plane named [[Warrior's Rest]] in the [[World Tree cosmology]] model.
* [[Leira]], the Lady of the Mists, once made her home called the [[Courts of Illusion]] here.
* [[Tapann]], the patron deity of [[korred]]s once made his home here.{{Cite dragon/119/The Ecology of the Korred}}
* [[Mystryl]], the Mother of All Magic, lived on this plane in her domain called [[Dweomertor]]<ref> until her death in {{Yearlink|-339}}.<ref>
* [[Astilabor]], the Hoardmistress of the [[Draconic pantheon]], was reputed to have a lair hidden somewhere in Limbo that contained more wealth than that found on all the planets of [[Realmspace]].<ref><ref group="note">The more recent but Core source ''[[Races of the Dragon]]'' places Astilabor in the [[Outlands]] instead.
* [[Kereska]], the draconic "Light of Magic", resided in Limbo.<ref>
* [[Agni]], the chaotic Vedic [[fire]] deity, had a mutable realm named [[Swarga]] here together with his fellow [[Lords of Creation]] [[Indra (deity)|Indra]] and [[Vayu]].<ref><ref>

Description.Susanowo: Named after a deity from the country of Japan on [[Earth]], he ruled a spherical bubble half filled with sea water and aquatic life and churned by storms of his making.
Description.Agni: Named after a deity from the country of India on [[Earth]], he resided in a sphere of pure flame that floated through the layers at his will.
Description.Indra: Also from India, Indra's sphere was half filled with enchanted milk and his palace stood on an island-sized tortoise (or possibly a tortoise-shaped island).
Description.Lost Gods: It was unknown if any race or deity favored this layer.

Cosmology.Afterlife:
{{Main|Afterlife}}
When souls arrived in the plane of Limbo, they were not allowed to manifest in some form but rather were absorbed into the matter of the plane. Occasionally a collection of spirits would become powerful enough to form what was called a ''chaos elemental'', not to be confused with a being from the [[elemental planes]].

document_data.History: According to a thrall captured by [[mind flayer]]s of [[Oryndoll]] beneath [[Andalbruin]], Limbo was the plane to which the [[batrachi]] retreated in {{Yearlink|-31500}}. There, they founded a realm called the [[Supreme Throne]].
